flags.title: Unpublished
flags.text: This project guide will not appear in search results but can still be viewed by anyone!

flags.title: User-Contributed Project
flags.text: This project guide is not managed by MAKE staff.

guide.introduction: So your about to power your new project but it seems like you don't have any 9v batteries in the toolbox. Don't worry if you have a micro controller because we can handle our little problem with that. Any micro controller will work but I will be using Arduino.
guide.introduction_rendered: So your about to power your new project but it seems like you don't have any 9v batteries in the toolbox. Don't worry if you have a micro controller because we can handle our little problem with that. Any micro controller will work but I will be using Arduino.

lines.text: First you must build a circuit! I will be using one of my old devices-electronic sensors lab-to build something really quick. I guess I will build a magnet sensor that buzzes. Simple-right?
lines.text_raw: First you must build a circuit! I will be using one of my old devices-electronic sensors lab-to build something really quick. I guess I will build a magnet sensor that buzzes. Simple-right?

guide.summary: This just a little neat hack to power your circuits. I didn't have a 9v on for a project I was working on so I decided to hack something up. P.S. I'm only 13 so please don't criticize me. And don't forget to go even further than what I have done. Enjoy!
guide.title: How to power your circuts with Arduino
